seg.seg: ... a man of means of the (city of Benares), Citraratha. Having noted his wife, he says: (Listen), ...
... having seen the cotton cloth of (queen Gautamī), ... gifts to the Community (Saṃghālambana) of seven kinds ...
... (all) living beings ... pay their respect to the Communities in many ways. || (... the man of means ...)
... close, (we were) wrong indeed. Now (I) have attained the joy of the Buddha's Law ...
... let us begin! How will we do away with the bad consequences of the actions done by us incessantly under the inﬂuence of heretic views?
… let us begin! How will we do away with the bad consequences of the actions done by us incessantly under the influence of heretic views? (193)
You have spoken (well), noble lady! Come here! Let the two of us go to the Ṛṣivadana monastery! When ... together ...
Come here! Let us both go to the Ṛṣivadana monastery! (cf 193)
Let us call (the monks)! Let us pay homage to them every day! || The wife says: Let us do it in this way!
... having bowed to the ground ... says: || In the Vanapraveśa [tune] || All thee time, the entire Community ... by me ...
... to pay homage. On one day I will invite two monks from the Community to (give them) alms.
Today I am inviting two monks from the community (to give them) alms … (193)
... the head of the monastery says: Good, good, you giver of gifts, the Community has received from you, sitting quietly, ...
Every day having risen early in the morning and performed the tasks in his house, having put on clean garments, ... perfumed (ﬂower) ...
... the coming of the (monks), he sees already from a distance. When the receivers of alms arrive, he goes to meet them.
When the receivers of alms arrive, he goes to meet them. (cf 193)
... having made them (enter) he makes them sit down on the seat of honor, he (honors them) with excellent food and drink, ...
... having risen, having put on new garments, with a perfumed ﬂower in his hand, having left the house, ...
... today, on the eighth day, I was to meet the receivers of alms, ...
... going, practicing ..., with the support of a stick (?) ... walking slowly, by old age, ... track (?) ...

p.note: This fragment contains part of the third act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; Uy. parallels are MaitrHami III, 10b16-11b(?) and MaitrSiŋgim, Taf. 25+94 (222). See also 196-7.
The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 194.
For this and the following line, compare MaitrHami 3, 10 b22-26 and in the Turfan version, 74, Taf. 25, recto.
na(sam ṣom caṃ) is restored after b5.
Cf. MaitrHami 3, 11 a5-6 and Taf. 94, "Rückseite" (but to be turned over) = recto, lines 3-4 (222); b6.
vanapraveśaṃ: a stanza of 4 x 14 (7/7) syllables.
Cf. the Turfan version, 74-75, Taf. 25, verso.
snum: 281 reads s_unum instead. This is a possibility, but the difference between this alleged s_un and normal sn (e.g. a1, a6) is very small.
For this line and the preceding line, cf. MaitrHami 3, 11 b3-8 and Taf. 94, "Vorderseite" (but to be turned over) = verso (222).

Cf. the Turfan version, 221, Taf. 92, recto). In the Turfan text of Maitrisimit, the fragments 25+94 belong to the 13th leaf and the fragments 92+99 belong to the 14th leaf of the third chapter, corresponding to the third act of the TA text.
